title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Quinta Dona Mafalda Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This wine offers very ripe fruit that gives an almost-sweet character to what should be a dry wine. There is acidity that helps. Drink now.

title: Half Mile Creek 2014 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)
description: Wet stone and graphite scents up front give way to hints of honey and Earl Grey tea (bergamot). It's medium bodied and fades quickly on the finish, but it's a solid buy for under $10.

title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)
description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Tuilerie Pagès  (Bordeaux)
description: The wine is rich and ready to drink. With red fruits and warm tannins, it is a ripe wine that has a light structure and balanced acidity. It is already an easy wine—fruity and soft at the end.

title: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2014 Fonte Venna  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Subdued aromas suggesting black plum, game and moist soil come together on this. The thin simple palate offers morello cherry and a hint of brown spice alongside loose, fleeting tannins and zesty acidity.
winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

title: Loft 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine smells mildly herbaceous and tastes sufficiently ripe and round to make it attractive to sip.

title: Weisinger 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: The wine was aged in 30% new American oak, and has modest cherry fruit with astringent tannins. There's an underlying earthy flavor, leading into a chalky finish.

title: Kopke 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This soft wine has muted red fruits and light acidity. Drink now.

title: Eguren 2015 Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Dry lime and citrus peel aromas are round and solid, nothing more. That more or less describes the palate, which tastes a little bit wheaty and dull, with a note of bitter melon on the finish. Drink now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Château Pindefleurs 2013  Saint-Émilion
description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine. Its burnt toast character doesn't chime with the light fruitiness of the vintage and so gives a wine that is bitter and extracted. Less overworking would have produced a better wine.

title: Cliff Creek 2012 Sams Valley Vineyard Merlot (Southern Oregon)
description: This wine seems overtaken with scents and flavors of tree tar and resin. The impression of pine resin cuts out the fruit, leaving some woody flavors in the finish.

title: Amalaya 2015 Esperanza Por Un Milagro White (Salta)
description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and lychee set up a lemony palate with pyrazine-influenced citrus flavors. Lychee is the lead flavor on a finish that's mildly bitter.

title: California Republic 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This good, basic wine offers herb and cherry aromas, mostly crisp fruit flavors and a firm, tannic texture.

title: Cantina Valle Tritana 2014 Capostrano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, plum and blue flower come together on this. The simple palate offers morello cherry and a hint of clove alongside soft, not very persistent tannins.

title: Château Doms 2014  Graves
description: This is a light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has spice and a layer of dry tannins that are acting as a support to the red fruits and acidity.

title: Hawkins Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The back label notes that this is the winery's reserve, sourced from Methven Family vineyards. The flavors seem to avoid ripe fruit in favor of stem, leaf and citrus. There's a bit of rhubarb, but nothing more substantial, and it quickly turns thin and tannic.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)
description: This is an attractive blend of grapes from different regions of Portugal. It is light, with crisp acidity and refreshing lemon fruit. The wine is soft and ready to drink.

title: Parras Wines 2014 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Produced at the Quinta do Gradil estate, this is a crisp, stalky and fruity wine. Black currants and hedgerow berry fruits are pushed forward by acidity. A hint of light wood aging helps smooth out the otherwise mineral aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Produced in central Alentejo in the warm region of Redondo, this is a surprisingly cool, crisp wine. Its blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto give plenty of acidity and citrus flavors. Green plum adds an extra richness. Drink this wine now.

title: Illuminati Dino 2010 Pieluni Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)
description: Aromas of steeped prune and raspberry jam mix with a note of used leather and chopped herb. The robust but evolved palate offers dried sour cherry, raisin, ground pepper and espresso alongside the heat of evident alcohol. Grainy tannins leave a bracing finish. The fruit has almost dried up completely so drink sooner rather than later.

title: Girasole 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This medium-bodied wine has low-key fruit and herb flavors, and a reasonably smooth texture. A touch of earthiness runs from aroma to finish.

title: Exem 2014  Bordeaux
description: The wine is soft with a toasty spicy character. That balances with the ripe berry fruits that are just on the stalky side of smooth. Drink this wine, with its fruity 70% Merlot, now.

title: Four Sisters Ranch 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is a bit slight on the nose but does show olallieberry, coffee, crushed lilac, soy and ganache aromas. There's interesting Asian spice to the palate, with sour plum and chocolate-sauce flavors.

title: Greyscale 2014 Cuvée Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine also includes 3% Sémillon, the whole fermented half in oak and half in stainless steel. Simple in its layers of vanilla and fleshy white peach, it shows a wealth of oak and tannin.

title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)
description: This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.

title: Manzwine 2015 Rosé (Lisboa)
description: Made from Castelão grapes, this crisp wine has red fruits that burst out of the glass and give a lively aftertaste, with tight acidity. Drink now.

title: Gianni Buonomo 2012 Sangiovese (Washington)
description: The volatiles are quite amped up here along with abundant barrel spices, such as vanilla and toast. The palate brings sweet jammy slightly dried-out raspberry and cranberry flavors but they have a hard time making up the difference.

title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Bairrada)
description: This ripe blend holds 80% Baga, with the rest Merlot. The Merlot softens the firmer tannins of the Baga, giving the wine its red-fruit character with a juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

title: Obsidian 2012 Molten Red (Oregon)
description: Equally amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot go into this high-octane blend. There are suggestions of black olive and dried leaf, but the fruit seems canned and the tannins have a tinny aftertaste.

title: Obsidian 2013 Tempranillo (Oregon)
description: This is a walk backward after the impressive 2012. Almost impenetrably black, the flavors converge around espresso and bitter chocolate, yet the tannins have a green edge. The wine simply feels flat in the mouth with no life to it.
